oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Field glasses presented to Blake Baker Thackston, Jr. 7th Tenn. Vol. Inf.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Union field glasses given to Sgt. Blake Baker Thackston, Jr. Co. B, 7th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA. A Union officer gave these to Thackston after the officer surrendered. Thackston was wounded at Fredericksburg, Va. in Dec. 1862 and spent much of the of the; war in a hospital in Charlottesville, Va., or detailed as a carpenter or hospital guard. He was paroled May 8, 1865 in Virginia. Thackston was from Sullivan's Bend, Smith Co., Tenn.
